UseCaseTitle: AI-Driven IT Asset Optimization and Cost Efficiency
Purpose: To monitor IT asset utilization metrics continuously and provide intelligent recommendations for decommissioning or consolidation, thereby improving cost efficiency and resource management in IT operations.
ExecSummary: IT organizations often struggle to manage and optimize their asset portfolios efficiently. Underutilized or redundant assets lead to unnecessary costs and operational complexity. This agent leverages real-time telemetry and AI-driven insights to optimize IT resources dynamically, helping enterprises reduce waste and improve ROI.
ExecSummaryKeyAsks: Automate monitoring of IT asset utilization
Provide actionable recommendations for asset decommissioning or consolidation
Enhance IT resource allocation and planning
BusinessObjectives: Improve IT cost efficiency by eliminating redundant or underutilized assets
Enhance visibility into asset performance and utilization
Support strategic decision-making with data-driven insights
BusinessBenefits: Improved asset lifecycle management and utilization rates
Reduced risks from asset sprawl and resource wastage
overview: This demo demonstrates an end-to-end Agentic AI framework integrating real-time monitoring tools (Prometheus, Grafana) with AI-powered agents that analyze IT assets, detect inefficiencies, and recommend optimization actions such as consolidation or decommissioning.
business: As IT environments grow increasingly complex, enterprises face challenges in tracking and optimizing asset usage effectively. Traditional manual audits are insufficient and costly. This solution automates asset monitoring and leverages AI to drive cost-saving decisions, essential in competitive and budget-conscious markets.
approach: The solution uses Prometheus for collecting utilization metrics and Grafana for visualization. AI agents built with Python and Agentic AI frameworks analyze telemetry data, detect underutilization patterns, and suggest optimization actions. LangGraph manages agent workflows, while contextual memory maintains state and historical data for trend analysis.
BusinessDrivers: Need to reduce IT operational expenditures
Drive efficiency through automation and AI insights
Improve transparency and governance of IT assets
Enable proactive resource management and capacity planning
BusinessChallanges: Lack of real-time visibility into asset utilization
Manual and error-prone asset management processes
Difficulty correlating disparate telemetry data sources
Inefficient resource allocation leading to cost overruns
FunctionalOverview: Continuous collection of IT asset metrics via Prometheus
Real-time dashboards and alerts through Grafana
AI-driven analysis to identify underutilized or redundant assets
Automated recommendations for consolidation or decommissioning
Contextual memory to track historical trends and decisions

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Collects real-time utilization and performance data from IT assets using Prometheus exporters.
KeyFeatures: Integration with multiple asset types and platforms
BusinessImpact: Ensures accurate and timely asset monitoring
Provides foundational data for AI analysis
Reduces blind spots in asset utilization

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Analyzes telemetry data to detect underutilization, inefficiencies, and opportunities for consolidation or decommissioning.
KeyFeatures: Integration with IT service management tools

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Presents actionable insights, alerts, and historical trends through Grafana dashboards and automated reports.
KeyFeatures: Automated summary reports for IT management

SolutionOverview: A multi-agent AI framework integrating real-time telemetry and analytics
Automated asset monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana
Contextual memory for trend analysis and historical data
LangGraph orchestration for scalable agent workflows
dataflow: Prometheus collects real-time utilization data from IT assets, which the Telemetry Collection Agent ingests and preprocesses. The Optimization Recommendation Agent analyzes this data, applies AI models to identify underutilization or consolidation opportunities, and generates actionable recommendations. Grafana visualizes metrics and alerts. Contextual memory stores historical states and decisions to improve future analysis.
design: Agents are modular and loosely coupled, communicating via contextual memory managed by LangGraph. Each agent handles specific functional responsibilities enabling easy scalability and maintainability. The design supports integration with existing ITSM tools and can be deployed on-prem or in the cloud.

cost.CAPEX: 45,000 - covering design, development, and infrastructure provisioning
